data.name: textBox1.Text
data.value:
Hello and thank you for using RRAS (Radiographic Rejection Auditing Software).
The Text boxes and Drop Down menus at the top of the program will allow you to filter down the number of records that appear in the database at the bottom of the program. Once you have finished entering the data you wish to view, press the search button and the database will update.
The two Drop Down menus are linked to one another. Comment will remain empty as long as RFR is empty. Once you select an item in RFR you will notice that Comment will now have items inside of it, these items vary depending on the item you have chosen in RFR.
The "Filter By" group of buttons will load different charts in the white space to the left of them. Each button will display the records that are linked to the ajoining departments.
"All Departments" will show the chart that uses all the records in the database.
The "Body Parts Examined" button will show a chart that counts and displays the number of times that body part appears in the database.
The "Chart Type" group of buttons will change the type of chart that is displayed. The "Stacked Bar Chart" button is only to be used when "All Departments" is being displayed.
When you press "File" in the top left corner of the program it will display further options, the "Close" button will close the program and the "Print Chart" button will create a popup window that will allow you to print out the chart that is currently being displayed in the program.
When you press "Upload" you will be given the option to press another button called "New File", pressing this will open a File Explorer that will allow you to search your computer for a tab delimited .txt file and import it into the database.
In the future, if a different Reject Category is added, it will require the program to be update to accept this new addtion. As this would take some time we have added a function that will allow you to temporarily use this new category. Pressing the "Option" button will give you access to a drop down menu with a button called "Alternative RFR". Pressing this will create a popup window where you may manually enter the new RFR, once you are done click the "Accept" button and you will find the new RFR in the RFR drop down menu. If you close and relaunch the program you will find that the RFR you added is no longer in the drop down menu and will need to be readded again.
Pressing the "Help" button will again, open a drop down menu where you can press the "User Guide" button which will then open the user guide popup window.
